title: Which 1975 thriller about a killer shark was directed by Steven Spielberg?
options: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
explanation: Jaws is a 1975 American thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg about a great white shark terrorizing a beach town.

title: Which 1977 film introduced audiences to the character Darth Vader?
options: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
explanation: Darth Vader first appeared in the 1977 film Star Wars, later retitled Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope.

title: Which actor played Indiana Jones in the 1981 film Raiders of the Lost Ark?
explanation: Harrison Ford stars as the archaeologist-adventurer Indiana Jones in Raiders of the Lost Ark.

title: Which 1985 film features a time machine built from a DeLorean sports car?
explanation: Back to the Future (1985) features a time machine built from a modified DeLorean car.

title: Which animated movie was Pixar’s first feature-length film, released in 1995?
explanation: Toy Story (1995) was Pixar’s first full-length feature film and the first entirely computer-animated feature.

title: Which 1994 film stars Tom Hanks as a man who unwittingly witnesses and influences key moments in U.S. history?
explanation: Forrest Gump (1994) stars Tom Hanks as Forrest, whose life intersects with many major historical events.

title: In which 2001 fantasy film does the elf Legolas first appear on the big screen?
options: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone
explanation: Legolas is introduced in The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001), portrayed by Orlando Bloom.

title: Which 2008 superhero movie launched the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU)?
explanation: Iron Man (2008) is the first film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

title: Which 2010 science-fiction film centers on thieves who enter dreams to implant ideas?
explanation: Inception (2010) follows a team that performs corporate espionage by entering and manipulating layered dreams.

title: Which 2019 superhero film briefly became the highest-grossing movie of all time before Avatar reclaimed the record?
explanation: Avengers: Endgame (2019) surpassed Avatar in 2019 to become the highest-grossing film, before Avatar retook the top spot after a 2021 re-release.

title: Which 2024 action film stars Jason Statham as a former beekeeper seeking revenge?
explanation: The Beekeeper (2024) stars Jason Statham in a revenge-driven action thriller directed by David Ayer.

title: Which 2024 animated film continues the story of Po as he trains a new Dragon Warrior?
explanation: Kung Fu Panda 4 (2024) follows Po as he prepares a successor while facing a powerful new villain.

title: In which 2024 thriller does Anne Hathaway play a widow navigating a high-profile romance?
explanation: The Idea of You (2024) stars Anne Hathaway as a woman who becomes romantically involved with a younger pop star.

title: Which 2024 film is a continuation of Denis Villeneuve’s adaptation of Frank Herbert’s novel?
explanation: Dune: Part Two (2024) continues Paul Atreides’ journey in Villeneuve’s adaptation of the sci-fi classic.

title: Which 2024 horror film follows a pop singer as she battles a mysterious supernatural curse?
explanation: Smile 2 (2024) stars Naomi Scott and continues the curse-based horror story introduced in Smile (2022).

title: Which 2024 movie features Millie Bobby Brown as a young woman chosen as a sacrificial offering to a dragon?
explanation: Damsel (2024) stars Millie Bobby Brown as a princess betrayed and offered to a dragon.

title: Which 2024 film is a musical reimagining of the famous Frankenstein story, written by Diablo Cody?
explanation: Lisa Frankenstein (2024) is a dark comedy romance written by Diablo Cody and directed by Zelda Williams.

title: Which 2024 superhero movie serves as a sequel to Joker (2019) and adds musical elements?
explanation: Joker: Folie à Deux (2024) is the musical-leaning sequel starring Joaquin Phoenix and Lady Gaga.

title: Which 2024 film stars Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar-Jones in a modern reimagining of the 1996 tornado classic?
explanation: Twisters (2024) continues the storm-chasing legacy of the original Twister.

title: Which 2024 sci-fi sequel reunites Kong and Godzilla to face a new threat?
options: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
explanation: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire (2024) continues the MonsterVerse storyline with both titans teaming up again.

title: Which 2024 sci-fi film stars Adam Sandler as a lonely astronaut encountering a mysterious creature?
explanation: Spaceman (2024) stars Adam Sandler as an astronaut who meets a strange spider-like creature voiced by Paul Dano.

title: In which 2024 comedy does Eddie Murphy reprise his role as detective Axel Foley?
explanation: Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F (2024) is the fourth installment of the franchise starring Eddie Murphy.

title: Which 2024 thriller features Sydney Sweeney as a nun experiencing disturbing visions?
explanation: Immaculate (2024) stars Sydney Sweeney as a nun pulled into a horrific conspiracy.

title: Which 2024 sports biographical film follows the life and career of wrestler-turned-actor Von Erich brothers?
explanation: The Iron Claw (wide 2024 release internationally) stars Zac Efron and Jeremy Allen White as the Von Erich brothers.

title: Which 2024 monster film introduces a new giant kaiju named Shimo?
options: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
explanation: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire (2024) features Shimo, a new ice-powered kaiju.

title: Which 2024 horror mystery stars Nicolas Cage as a reclusive serial killer known as Longlegs?
explanation: Longlegs (2024) stars Nicolas Cage as the terrifying serial killer Longlegs.

title: Which 2024 film adapts the video game series about a vault dweller in a post-apocalyptic world?
explanation: Fallout (2024) is a major adaptation of the iconic Bethesda game series.

title: Which 2024 psychedelic fantasy features Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo as Glinda and Elphaba?
explanation: Wicked: Part One (2024) is the first installment of the movie adaptation of the Broadway musical Wicked.

title: Which 2024 film is a sequel to the horror movie The Black Phone?
explanation: The Black Phone 2 (2024) continues the story of the original film featuring the Grabber.

title: In One Battle After Another (2025), who plays the washed-up revolutionary Bob?
explanation: Leonardo DiCaprio stars as Bob, a former radical living off-grid.

title: What real-world event forms the backdrop of My Undesirable Friends: Part I – Last Air in Moscow (2025)?
options: The fall of the Soviet Union
explanation: The documentary follows independent journalists during Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: What sets the plot in motion in It Was Just an Accident (2025)?
explanation: A seemingly minor accident sparks escalating consequences.

title: In The Secret Agent (2025), where does Marcelo arrive while on the run?
explanation: Marcelo arrives in Recife during carnival week.

title: What system is exposed in The Alabama Solution (2025)?
explanation: The film focuses on corruption and brutality in one of America’s deadliest prison systems.

title: Where does the journey in BLKNWS: Terms & Conditions (2025) ultimately lead?
explanation: Funmilayo Akechukwu’s work leads to a journey into the heart of the Atlantic Ocean.

title: What is Agnes dealing with in Sorry, Baby (2025)?
explanation: The film notes that something bad happened to Agnes, and life moves on around her.

title: What mission is depicted in 2000 Meters to Andriivka (2025)?
options: A platoon advancing one mile through fortified forest
explanation: The film follows a Ukrainian platoon attempting to cross one mile of fortified forest to liberate a village.

title: Which profession does Robert Grainier have in Train Dreams (2025)?
explanation: Grainier is a logger and railroad worker in early 20th-century America.

title: In Familiar Touch (2025), what condition shapes Ruth’s story?
explanation: Ruth is in a memory-care facility due to worsening memory loss.

title: In On Becoming a Guinea Fowl (2025), what event triggers buried family secrets to surface?
explanation: Shula discovers her uncle’s body on the road, which leads to hidden family secrets being revealed.

title: In Caught by the Tides (2025), what motivates Qiaoqiao to begin her long journey?
options: She wants to start a band
explanation: Qiaoqiao travels to look for Bin after he disappears without telling her.

title: What profession does Gustav hold in Sentimental Value (2025)?
explanation: Gustav is a once-renowned director trying to stage a comeback.

title: In A Little Prayer (2025), what war did Bill, the family patriarch, serve in?
explanation: Bill is a Vietnam veteran living in North Carolina.

title: In April (2025), what event places Nina’s medical career under scrutiny?
explanation: Nina is investigated after the death of a newborn under her care.

title: What motivates the protagonist’s plan in No Other Choice (2025)?
options: Securing a job by eliminating competition
explanation: He devises a scheme to remove job competitors after years of unemployment.

title: In The Tale of Silyan (2025), what creature sparks the story’s transformation?
explanation: A wounded white stork rescued from a landfill changes the farmer’s life.

title: What tragic real event forms the core of The Voice of Hind Rajab (2025)?
explanation: The film follows emergency workers trying to save a six-year-old girl trapped in a car under fire.

title: In Afternoons of Solitude (2025), which cultural tradition is the focus of the documentary?
explanation: The film explores the beauty and brutality of bullfighting through matador Andrés Roca Rey.

title: Where is Anand forced to spend ten days in Cactus Pears (2025)?
explanation: He must complete a 10-day mourning period in rural western India.

title: In Past Lives (2023), what separates Nora and Hae Sung as children?
options: Nora’s emigration to Canada and later the U.S.
explanation: Nora’s family emigrates from South Korea, ending their childhood proximity.

title: In Trenque Lauquen Parte I (2023), what discovery sets the investigation in motion?
options: A hidden set of love letters
explanation: Secret love letters found in library books lead to revelations about Laura’s disappearance.

title: In Trenque Lauquen Parte II (2023), what theme drives the second half of the story?
options: Uncovering multiple narrative mysteries around Laura
explanation: The film deepens the exploration of interconnected mysteries surrounding Laura.

title: Our Body (2023) documents which type of medical setting?
explanation: The film observes the workings of a public hospital’s gynecological ward.

title: De Humani Corporis Fabrica (2023) primarily offers unprecedented cinematic access to what?
options: The interior of the human body
explanation: The documentary reveals internal human landscapes through surgical and clinical imagery.

title: What is the central setting in The Zone of Interest (2023)?
explanation: The film portrays the Höss family household located directly next to Auschwitz.

title: Menus Plaisirs – Les Troisgros (2023) focuses on which famous restaurant tradition?
options: A multi-generational French Michelin-starred family restaurant
explanation: It documents day-to-day operations of the Troisgros family’s Michelin-starred establishments.

title: In Saint Omer (2023), the protagonist Rama attends what event?
explanation: Rama observes the murder trial of Laurence Coly, which challenges her assumptions.

title: In The Boy and the Heron (2023), Mahito enters a world where what occurs?
options: Life and death merge and transform
explanation: He enters a realm where the boundaries of life and death dissolve.

title: What is the thematic focus of 32 Sounds (2023)?
options: The nature and experience of sound
explanation: It is a sensory documentary exploring how sound shapes memory and perception.

title: In All of Us Strangers (2023), what unusual discovery does Adam make when revisiting his childhood home?
options: His parents are still alive exactly as they were decades earlier
explanation: Adam finds his parents appearing unchanged and living as if they never died.

title: Oppenheimer (2023) centers on what historical project?
explanation: The film dramatizes Oppenheimer’s leadership of the Manhattan Project.

title: Killers of the Flower Moon (2023) depicts crimes committed against which community?
explanation: The story follows the murders targeting wealthy Osage people in the 1920s.

title: Ear for Eye (2023) examines experiences of which groups?
explanation: The film follows Black characters in the UK and US navigating contemporary racial realities.

title: In Poor Things (2023), how is Bella Baxter brought into the world?
options: Through resurrection by an eccentric scientist
explanation: Dr. Godwin Baxter resurrects Bella, who then seeks worldly experience.

title: In Our Father, the Devil (2023), what shocks Marie upon meeting the new priest?
options: He is the man who saved her life
He is the warlord who destroyed her family
He speaks her native language fluently
explanation: Marie recognizes him as the warlord responsible for her family’s killing.

title: Mami Wata (2023) depicts conflict in a village devoted to which deity?
explanation: The story unfolds in a community centered around the water spirit Mami Wata.

title: Robot Dreams (2023) follows the friendship between which characters?
options: A dog and a robot he builds
A chef and a stray cat
explanation: Dog builds Robot to cure his loneliness, forming a deep bond.

title: In Walk Up (2023), Byungsoo visits a building owned by whom?
options: An old friend who is an established designer
explanation: He and his daughter tour a multi-purpose building owned by a designer friend.

title: All Dirt Roads Taste of Salt (2023) spans what setting?
options: A single Louisiana town during the 1950s
explanation: The film traces a woman’s life across generations in Mississippi.

title: Blue Jean (2023) centers on what political moment in the UK?
explanation: Jean struggles with her identity as Thatcher’s government passes Section 28 targeting LGBTQ people.

title: Renaissance: A Film by Beyoncé (2023) documents what?
options: The Renaissance World Tour from conception to finale
explanation: The film presents the creation and execution of the Renaissance World Tour.

title: Anatomy of a Fall (2023) revolves around determining what?
options: Whether Samuel’s death was suicide or murder
explanation: Sandra becomes the prime suspect when her husband is found dead outside their chalet.

title: Fallen Leaves (2023) depicts a romance between two what?
explanation: Two lonely, working-class strangers attempt to build a connection in modern-day Helsinki.

title: In Aftersun (2022), what is Sophie trying to reconcile?
options: The father she knew with the man she didn’t
explanation: Sophie reflects on holiday memories as she tries to understand the father she only partly knew.

title: TÁR (2022) follows Lydia Tár, who holds what historic distinction?
options: First woman to win a Pulitzer
First female chief conductor of a major German orchestra
First female composer of a national anthem
First woman to direct the Vienna Opera
explanation: Lydia Tár is portrayed as the first female chief conductor of a major German orchestra.

title: No Bears (2022) features what central narrative device?
explanation: The film presents two parallel love stories shaped by power structures and superstition.

title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed (2022) centers on which activist figure?
explanation: The documentary follows Nan Goldin’s art, activism, and fight against the Sackler family.

title: Hit the Road (2022) follows what type of journey?
options: A family road trip across Iran
explanation: A family of four travels across the Iranian countryside, bonding and confronting uncertainty.

title: The Worst Person in the World (2022) tells the story in how many chapters?
explanation: Julie’s story unfolds in twelve chapters covering several years of her life.

title: Great Freedom (2022) revolves around Hans, who is repeatedly imprisoned under which law?
explanation: Hans is imprisoned again and again under Paragraph 175 in postwar Germany.

title: Mr. Bachmann and His Class (2022) documents the work of a teacher in what kind of setting?
explanation: The teacher works with students from many countries in a diverse German city.

title: In The Quiet Girl (2022), where is Cait sent for the summer?
explanation: Cait is sent to live with foster parents, where she begins to thrive.

title: Three Minutes: A Lengthening (2022) expands on footage shot in which year?
explanation: The documentary dissects three minutes of 1938 footage of the Jewish residents of Nasielsk.

title: Aftershock (2022) responds to what pressing crisis?
explanation: The film confronts the maternal mortality crisis following two preventable deaths.

title: A Night of Knowing Nothing (2022) reveals social unrest through what narrative device?
explanation: The story unfolds through fictional letters found in a film-school cupboard.

title: Return to Seoul (2022) follows Freddie as she returns to which country?
explanation: Freddie returns to South Korea, where she was born before her adoption.

title: All That Breathes (2022) focuses on the rescue of which bird?
explanation: Two brothers run a makeshift bird hospital to save black kites in New Delhi.

title: Descendant (2022) investigates the legacy of which ship?
explanation: The Clotilda was the last illegal slave ship to reach the U.S., central to the film’s inquiry.

title: The Banshees of Inisherin (2022) begins with what shocking event?
options: Colm ending his friendship with Padraic
explanation: Colm abruptly ends the lifelong friendship, triggering escalating conflict.

title: Playground (2022) primarily explores what theme?
explanation: Nora watches her brother Abel being bullied and faces pressure to remain silent.

title: Happening (2022) follows Anne as she attempts what in 1963 France?
options: To track down her birth parents
explanation: Anne risks shame, pain, and prison seeking an abortion to save her future.

title: My Imaginary Country (2022) covers massive protests in which city?
explanation: Patricio Guzmán documents the Chilean uprising in Santiago.

title: One Fine Morning (2022) centers on Sandra juggling what two major challenges?
options: Caring for her sick father and an affair
Financial struggles and a legal battle
explanation: Sandra cares for her ailing father while entering a relationship with a married friend.

title: In Front of Your Face (2022) follows Sangok as she returns to which city?
explanation: Sangok returns to Seoul after living abroad and confronts hidden truths.

title: Decision to Leave (2022) begins with the death of a man who fell from where?
explanation: Detective Hae-joon investigates after a man falls from a mountain summit.

title: The Fabelmans (2022) centers on Sammy Fabelman’s passion for what?
explanation: Sammy’s love for filmmaking drives the coming-of-age story.

title: Quo Vadis, Aida? (2021) is set during which historical event?
explanation: The film is set in Srebrenica in July 1995, leading up to the genocide.

title: Summer of Soul (2021) centers on which long-unseen event?
explanation: The documentary showcases the 1969 Harlem Cultural Festival, whose footage sat unseen for 50 years.

title: Rocks (2021) follows a teenage girl who must care for whom?
explanation: Rocks suddenly becomes responsible for her younger brother after their mother disappears.

title: Petite Maman (2021) begins after Nelly experiences which loss?
explanation: Nelly has just lost her grandmother and is helping clean out her mother’s childhood home.

title: In Memoria (2021), what triggers Jessica’s strange experiences?
options: A mysterious loud bang at dawn
explanation: A loud bang heard at daybreak sparks a chain of sensory disturbances.

title: Days (2021) centers on the meeting between Kang and Non under what circumstances?
options: A chance reunion between old friends
explanation: Kang, adrift from illness, meets Non in a foreign country, providing each other brief consolation.

title: Drive My Car (2021) features Misaki Watari in what role?
explanation: Misaki is assigned to chauffeur Yusuke Kafuku in his red Saab 900.

title: Flee (2021) recounts Amin's story primarily through what medium?
explanation: The film uses animation to tell Amin’s refugee story.

title: This Is Not a Burial, It’s a Resurrection (2021) features Mantoa fighting against what threat?
options: A dam project that would flood her village
explanation: A planned dam would displace her community and destroy the burial grounds.

title: Licorice Pizza (2021) is set in which decade?
explanation: The story follows Alana and Gary in the San Fernando Valley in 1973.

title: Procession (2021) follows six men using what process to confront trauma?
explanation: The survivors create dramatic scenes to process their childhood abuse by clergy.

title: Wojnarowicz (2021) documents the work of an artist active during which crisis?
explanation: David Wojnarowicz’s activism was central during the AIDS epidemic in 1980s New York.

title: The Souvenir: Part II (2021) follows Julie as she creates what?
options: A graduation film processing her past relationship
explanation: Julie turns to filmmaking to untangle the truth of her painful relationship.

title: The Power of the Dog (2021) centers on Phil Burbank, who is known for what demeanor?
explanation: Phil’s charisma is intimidating and manipulative, shaping the ranch’s emotional landscape.

title: Azor (2021) follows a banker traveling to which country during a dictatorship?
explanation: A Swiss private banker arrives in Argentina to investigate his partner’s disappearance.

title: The Father (2021) uses what technique to depict Anthony’s condition?
options: A nonlinear environment shifting with his memory
explanation: Rooms, people, and timelines subtly shift to reflect Anthony’s unraveling memory.

title: Parallel Mothers (2021) begins with Janis and Ana meeting where?
explanation: The women meet in the maternity ward as they prepare to give birth.

title: The Human Voice (2021) centers on a woman waiting for what?
options: Her ex-lover to pick up his suitcases
explanation: She waits beside her ex-lover’s suitcases, though he never arrives.

title: The Velvet Underground (2021) explores the rise of what?
options: One of rock’s most influential avant-garde bands
explanation: Todd Haynes documents the avant-garde band’s formation and cultural impact.

title: Attica (2021) recounts the 1971 uprising at what institution?
explanation: The film revisits the Attica prison uprising and its lasting implications.

title: Can You Bring It: Bill T. Jones and D-Man in the Waters (2021) explores the legacy of which art form?
explanation: The documentary examines the creation and legacy of Bill T. Jones’ iconic dance work.

title: About Endlessness (2021) uses what narrative style?
explanation: The film unfolds through poetic, dreamlike tableaux linked by a narrator.

title: Hope (2021) follows Anja and Tomas as they confront what crisis?
explanation: Anja’s terminal diagnosis forces the couple to rebuild trust and face mortality together.

title: Small Axe: Lovers Rock (2020) is set during what event?
options: A house party in 1980s West London
explanation: The film takes place over one night at a house party filled with romance, tension, and music.

title: Collective (2020) begins investigating corruption after what incident?
explanation: A nightclub fire exposes dysfunction and corruption that journalists uncover at a national scale.

title: David Byrne’s American Utopia (2020) documents which performance?
options: A Broadway stage show by David Byrne
explanation: Spike Lee directs the filmed version of Byrne’s acclaimed Broadway production.

title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always (2020) follows Autumn as she travels to New York City for what purpose?
options: An abortion unavailable in her home state
explanation: Autumn and Skylar cross state lines to obtain an abortion and navigate a difficult system.

title: Time (2020) focuses on Fox Rich’s decades-long fight to free whom?
explanation: Fox Rich campaigns for her husband Rob’s release from a 60-year sentence.

title: First Cow (2020) centers on a business venture reliant on what?
options: Secretly stealing milk from a landowner’s prized cow
explanation: The men build a business using milk taken covertly from a wealthy landowner’s cow.

title: Small Axe: Mangrove (2020) tells the story of which real trial?
explanation: The Mangrove Nine trial followed arrests after protests against police harassment.

title: Minari (2020) follows a Korean-American family trying to farm where?
explanation: The Yi family moves to rural Arkansas to build their own farm and future.

title: Gunda (2020) focuses primarily on what?
options: Daily life of farm animals filmed in black-and-white
explanation: The film observes pigs, chickens, and cows with meditative intimacy.

title: Dick Johnson Is Dead (2020) presents imaginative scenes depicting what?
explanation: The filmmaker stages elaborate fictional deaths for her father as a way to cope with loss.

title: City Hall (2020) documents what institution’s daily work?
explanation: Frederick Wiseman chronicles Boston’s municipal government and civic services.

title: Hamilton (2020) is a filmed version of what?
explanation: The movie captures the original Broadway cast filmed live at the Richard Rodgers Theatre.

title: Wolfwalkers (2020) features Robyn befriending whom?
options: A girl from a wolf-transforming tribe
explanation: Robyn bonds with Mebh, a girl whose people transform into wolves at night.

title: Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom (2020) is set during what type of event?
explanation: The story unfolds over one intense recording session where conflicts erupt.

title: Small Axe: Education (2020) focuses on what injustice?
explanation: Kingsley is wrongly sent to a school for 'special needs' children under a discriminatory policy.

title: Nomadland (2020) follows Fern as she adopts what lifestyle?
explanation: After losing her town and job, Fern travels the American West in her van.

title: Rewind (2020) is constructed using what source?
options: A vast archive of family home videos
explanation: The filmmaker pieces together his childhood trauma through his father’s video recordings.

title: What the Constitution Means to Me (2020) documents what?
options: A filmed Broadway play by Heidi Schreck
explanation: It is a filmed version of Heidi Schreck’s acclaimed Broadway play.

title: The Wolf House (2020) uses animation to depict Maria’s escape from what?
options: A sect inspired by Colonia Dignidad
explanation: Maria flees a cult modeled on the real Colonia Dignidad and enters a nightmarish house.

title: Divine Love (2020) portrays Joana working in what unusual future setting?
options: A bureaucratic office in 2027 Brazil influencing marriages
explanation: Joana uses her government post to steer couples toward reconciliation through a religious cult.

title: Welcome to Chechnya (2020) follows activists protecting whom?
explanation: The film documents activists rescuing LGBTQ+ people from the region’s ongoing pogrom.

title: Vitalina Varela (2020) follows the title character arriving in Lisbon only to discover what?
explanation: Vitalina arrives after decades apart, only to learn her husband has just been buried.
